benchmark_details.name: Explicit vs. Implicit Biographies: Evaluating and Adapting LLM Information Extraction on Wikidata-Derived Texts
benchmark_details.overview: This study examines how textual implicitness affects Information Extraction (IE) tasks in pre-trained LLMs by generating two synthetic datasets of 10k implicit and explicit verbalizations of biographic information. It analyzes whether fine-tuning with implicit data improves LLM performance in extracting information.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate the effects of implicit and explicit information on LLM performance in information extraction tasks and to explore the improvements through fine-tuning.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Results are limited to biographical data and may not reflect the complexity of naturally occurring implicit information.

data.source: Synthetic dataset generated from Wikidata triples.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on semantic distance between model outputs and ground truth using BLEURT.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and F1 scores indicate better performance in implicit reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Llama 3.2-1B model trained and tested on implicit data achieved an accuracy of 93.3%.
methodology.validation: Statistical significance assessed via Wilcoxon signed-rank test.
